doc.field: ACT-UAW Local 7902 represents over 4,000 part-time and adjunct teachers at the New School and New York University. This collection is consists of the websites for Local 7902, dating back to 2013. The union is made-up of four bargaining units, the New York University Adjuncts, New School Part-Time Faculty (PTF), New School Student Employees (SENS), and New School Student Health Services Employees (SHENS).

ACT-UAW Local 7902 represents over 4,000 part-time and adjunct teachers at the New School and New York University. This collection is consists of the websites for Local 7902, dating back to 2013. The union is made-up of four bargaining units, the New York University Adjuncts, New School Part-Time Faculty (PTF), New School Student Employees (SENS), and New School Student Health Services Employees (SHENS).

This collection is consists of the websites for ACT-UAW, Local 7902, dating back to 2013. The union is made-up of four bargaining units, the New York University Adjuncts, New School Part-Time Faculty (PTF), New School Student Employees (SENS), and New School Student Health Services Employees (SHENS). The websites contain current and past contracts, memoranda of agreement, summaries of rights and benefits, arbitrations, information about their committees and stewards, election results, bargaining updates, strike authorizations, events, news from the union's president, their newsletter, and a gallery of their members' art. Issues of the newsletter, Adjunct Voice, date from 2006-2009. The website has redesigned three times since crawling began, once in 2014, 2017, and mid-2021.

The collection also contains the websites and social media for the bargaining campaigns for NYU Adjuncts and New School Part-Time Faculty units for new contracts in 2022. These websites highlight negotiations between the units and their respectively administrations at New York Univesity and the New School.

The website for the Student Employees of The New School (SENS-UAW) is also in the collection and represents academic student workers at the New School. The website mostly details their efforts to unionize starting in 2015 to their union vote in 2017 to their strike in 2018 and subsequent contract. The website also contains information on rights and benefits, their contract, an FAQ, and a newsletter.

The NYU Contract Faculty United (CFU-UAW Local 7902) is the union for New York University full-time non-tenure track continuing contract faculty on renewable appointments from across the university. Its objective is to establish recognition of the union and collective bargaining with the NYU administration. The website contains testimonials from faculty, petition to administration demanding a union, news regarding the unionization efforts dating back to 2020, FAQs for faculty and students, solidarity letters from other unions, examples of contract gains by similar academic unions, authorization cards, and other news regarding action campaigns.

In early 2023, the New Student Workers Union began organizing. NSWU is a group of student workers at the New School seeking to create a union made up of all student workers not covered by the Student Employees at The New School (SENS) union. As of this writing (April 2023), the organizing committee is working to get a majority of student workers to sign authorization cards to seek official recognition from the university. The linktree also includes an FAQ and links to their social media.

ACT-UAW Local 7902 (Adjuncts Come Together, in some early contracts they also have gone by Academics Coming Together) represents over 4,000 part-time and adjunct teachers at the New School and New York University. The union was formed in 2002 by adjuncts at NYU, which first ratified their first contract in 2004 and elected their first executive officers in 2005. In 2004, adjuncts at the New School began to negotiate, and reached an agreement with the New School in 2005. The union has successfully negotiated better pay, job security, partially subsidized health care, pension benefits, and promoted transparency within the universities' budgetary systems. In 2015, Tandon adjuncts voted yes for union representation.

In 2015, academic student workers at the New School began organizing under Local 7902. In 2017, they voted to form a union and went on strike in 2018. They won a contract with the New School. During the COVID-19 pandemic, New School part-time faculty voted to ratify a pandemic recovery plan. In 2022, contract negotiations began for New School and New York University adjunct teachers.
In 2022-2023, contract faculty at New York University began organizing for NYU administration to recognize their union. In 2023, the New Student Workers Union at the New School began organizing.

In 2013, http://www.actuaw.org/ was initially selected by curators and captured through the use of The California Digital Library's Web Archiving Service in 2013 as part of the Labor Unions and Organizations (U.S.) Web Archive. In November 2015, the website was migrated to Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In May 2022, https://youarethenewschool.com/ was added. The accession number associated with this website is 2022.062. In July 2022, https://sensuaw.org/ and https://www.nyuowesadjuncts.com/ were added. The accession number associated with these websites is 2022.067. In November 2022 Google documents related to bargaining were added to the the collection. The accession number associated with these documents is 2022.088. In December 2022, https://twitter.com/uaw7902/ and https://www.instagram.com/act_uaw7902/ were added. The accession number associated with these websites is 2023.002. In February 2023, https://nyucontractfacultyunion.org/ and https://vimeo.com/user190072101/ were added. The accession number associated with these websites is 2023.022. In March 2023, https://linktr.ee/nswu/ was added. The accession number associated with this website 2023.037. In June 2023, https://newstudentworkersunion.com/ was added. The accession number associated with this website is 2023.061.

Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.
Robots.txt (a piece of code designed to limit crawler activity within a website) was ignored. Websites were rescoped to include Google Documents.

Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Crawling of the Instagram feed was performed in WebRecorder.
